attributes.action: make single rail fares half the price of the equivalent return
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A single rail ticket for off-peak travel is often only £1 cheaper than the equivalent return.  This means that rail does not integrate well with e.g. bus travel, car sharing, or cycling, as not much money can be saved by taking the train one way only.  Similarly it is often cheaper to fly both ways on a budget airline than to fly one way and take the train back.

The train should be ideally suited to flexible travel, and this would help the environment too, but the cost of a single ticket needs to be roughly half that of a return.
